text: Fixture submittals match approved schedules: types, wattage, beam angle, IP rating, finish
Mounting and cutout dimensions coordinated with ceilings/walls (ACT, GWB, millwork, concrete)
Emergency and exit fixtures shown and labeled on plans, including battery backup type
Fixture securely mounted (recessed clips, brackets, pendant kits) per manufacturer instructions
J-boxes or mounting rails installed level and rated for load
Fixture wiring connected with proper polarity, bonding, and strain relief
Trims, lenses, and diffusers installed without scratches or gaps
Emergency lighting circuits separately identified and operational
Pole base depth, anchor bolts, leveling, and conduit entry verified
Site luminaires mounted to pole with gaskets, anti-vibration washers, and wired per code
Photocell or time-clock control integrated and tested
Fixture loads match circuit breaker and wiring gauge
Dimming zones and switching logic confirmed to match control intent
Lighting control panel connections verified and tagged
Final aiming, focusing, and beam spread tested and documented
As-built fixture schedule and circuit references submitted
Manufacturer warranty tags, commissioning forms, and programming documents handed over
